series.series.name: CURRENTS: DESIGN FOR CHILDREN -- JUNIOR BOOMERS

abstract.p: Bumper crop of babies seems to have occurred at turn of 20th century and early in 2000; drawing (S)

block.p: Demographers say that the echo baby boom (bigger than the postwar baby boom) ended with the 90's. Really? Then why do there seem to be so many babies around? Anecdotal evidence points to more Asian-American babies born in the Year of the Dragon, a propitious lunar period that began Feb. 5. Other parents wanted babies born with the century. And then there was the Y2K factor, babies born nine months after their parents celebrated New Year. The first week of October, there were 2,534 babies born in New York City, versus 2,281 last year. Erich Giebelhaus, a spokesman for the Department of Health, said the increase is too small to make a baby boomlet. Tell that to retailers.

Demographers say that the echo baby boom (bigger than the postwar baby boom) ended with the 90's. Really? Then why do there seem to be so many babies around? Anecdotal evidence points to more Asian-American babies born in the Year of the Dragon, a propitious lunar period that began Feb. 5. Other parents wanted babies born with the century. And then there was the Y2K factor, babies born nine months after their parents celebrated New Year. The first week of October, there were 2,534 babies born in New York City, versus 2,281 last year. Erich Giebelhaus, a spokesman for the Department of Health, said the increase is too small to make a baby boomlet. Tell that to retailers.
CURRENTS: DESIGN FOR CHILDREN -- JUNIOR BOOMERS
